title: Configurable error handling and reliable retry logic
description: Make error handling configurable via config.json and fix the bug where Node.js unhandled promise rejections bypass shell pipe capture. Currently retries are hardcoded and 'No messages returned' errors sometimes print to terminal but aren't caught by the retry logic.

acceptanceCriteria.text: Add errorHandling section to config.json schema
Update ralph-setup wizard to include error handling config
Load error handling settings from config.json in ralph.zsh
FIX: Capture Node.js unhandled promise rejections properly
- Use script(1) or unbuffer to capture all terminal output
- OR: Wrap claude-code call with node --unhandled-rejections=strict
- OR: Pipe stderr separately and merge after
Add error pattern: 'This error originated' (Node.js rejection preamble)
Add error pattern: 'promise rejected with the reason'
Test: Simulate 'No messages returned' - verify retry triggers
Test: Verify config.json settings are respected
Document error handling config in README
